name: fail2ban
tagline: A security service that blocks malicious login attempts using log analysis
description: Fail2Ban scans log files to detect malicious login attempts and automatically updates firewall rules to block offending IPs. It is widely used to protect SSH and other services on Linux servers with minimal configuration.

features.title: Log-Based Intrusion Detection
features.description: Monitors log files to detect repeated authentication failures

features.title: Automated Banning
features.description: Temporarily blocks IP addresses that trigger defined rules

features.title: Service Profiles
features.description: Includes predefined rules for common services like SSH and web servers

features.title: Custom Filters
features.description: Allows defining custom patterns to match log events

features.title: Multiple Ban Actions
features.description: Supports firewall rules email notifications and custom actions

features.title: Whitelisting
features.description: Excludes trusted IP addresses from bans

features.title: Runtime Control
features.description: Manages jails and bans without restarting services

features.title: Self-Hosted Security Service
features.description: Run the service on your own servers
